page.title: 14HOUSING
page.content: Hartpury village covers a wide area because originally it consisted of 'Ends' e.g. Murrells End, Moorend, Blackwells End. The 'End' signifies a clearance in a forest at the end of a path to a hamlet. Traces of these old stone and timber framed buildings are still seen today. In C19th, New Court House,now Hartpury House, was built for the Canning Family, who built many brick houses on their estate (identifiable by 'GC' markings); building materials were obtained from Brick Pits Quarry in Ashleworth Lane. The only building in C20th has been at Danford Villas except for a few individual developments. Similarly most buildings in Highleadon and Rudford are scattered and date from previous centuries, except for a council development built about 1945.
